Report.Name: Customers and Suppliers by City Report
Territories and employees

DataSource.RecordSource:
SELECT *
FROM EmployeeTerritories et, Employees e, Territories t
WHERE et.EmployeeID = e.EmployeeID and et.TerritoryID = t.TerritoryID

Report.OnOpen: ' -- style script start _styleCtr = 0 ' -- style script end

Section.Name: Detail
Section.OnPrint: ' -- style script start detail.BackColor = iif(_styleCtr mod 2 = 0, rgb(255,255,255),rgb(231,222,201)) _styleCtr = _styleCtr + 1 ' -- style script end

Field.Name: titleLbl
Field.Text: Employees and Territories they are responsible for

Field.Name: Field2
Field.Text: This report demonstrates the use of a Lines layer. In a line layer, each line connects two points. In this sample, one point is the location of an employee, while the other is the location of the territory that employee is responsible for.

DataSource.RecordSource:
SELECT c.Country, c.City, c.CompanyName, c.ContactName, s.Country, s.City, s.CompanyName, s.ContactName FROM Customers c, Suppliers s
WHERE c.Country = s.Country
ORDER BY c.Country

Section.Name: GroupHeader0
Section.OnFormat: map1.Layers("l_customers").Recordsource = "select City, Country from Customers where Country='" + [s.Country] + "'"

Field.Name: Field2
Field.Text:
This sample shows how to use a KML layer as an easy way to auto zoom to a geographical entity defined by the KML file rather than to spatial data from a database.
The report is grouped by countries. The group header includes two maps, both using the World Map KML file as one of the layers. The bigger map on the right shows the physical map of the world, with KML layer on top of that. Visible KML items are those that have the name equal to the current (group) country name, so effectively only the current country's KML data is used. The KML stroke and fill use semi transparent reddish colors to highlight the current country on the world map (auto zoom and center is turned off on that map).
The smaller map on the left also includes a KML layer with the World Map KML file as the source. Again, the visibility of the KML items is determined by the current country. Unlike the bigger map, the small map does have auto zoom and center turned on. With KML items being tracked (so that their coordinates are taken into account by auto zoom/center), this effectively makes the smaller map show just the map of the current country. Note that all visible elements of the KML layer are effectively made invisible so this layer is only used to auto zoom to the current country's bounds.
Finally, the second KML layer in the smaller map is used to "mask out" countries EXCEPT the current country. This is achieved by specifying that items should be visible only if their name is NOT the current country, and specifying a semi-transparent gray fill color which visually masks non-current countries.

Report.Name: Order Totals by Country

DataSource.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipCountry, Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue
FROM (Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID
GROUP BY Orders.ShipCountry
ORDER BY Orders.ShipCountry;

Report.OnOpen: ' -- style script start _styleCtr = 0 ' -- style script end

Section.Name: Detail
Section.OnPrint: ' -- style script start detail.BackColor = iif(_styleCtr mod 2 = 0, rgb(255,255,255),rgb(231,222,201)) _styleCtr = _styleCtr + 1 ' -- style script end

LayerBase.Name: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.Caption: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipCountry, Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue
FROM (Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID
GROUP BY Orders.ShipCountry
ORDER BY Orders.ShipCountry;
LayerBase.ItemStyleExpr: iif (kmlItemName=ShipCountry and OrderValue > 0, iif (OrderValue > 200000, "s200k_up", iif (OrderValue > 100000, "s100k_200k", iif (OrderValue > 50000, "s50k_100k", iif (OrderValue > 25000, "s25k_50k", "s0_25k")))), "sZero" )

DataSource.RecordSource: SELECT Country, City, CompanyName, ContactName, Longitude, Latitude FROM Customers_Map

Section.Name: GroupHeader0
Section.OnFormat: map1.Layers("Suppliers").Recordsource = "select * from Suppliers where Suppliers.Country='" + Country + "'"

Field.Name: Field1

DataSource.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipRegion, Orders.ShipCountry, StateNamesGeo.StateName,
Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue,
(select Longitude from StateNamesGeo where StateNamesGeo.Abbr = Orders.ShipRegion) as Longitude,
(select Latitude from StateNamesGeo where StateNamesGeo.Abbr = Orders.ShipRegion) as Latitude
FROM ((Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID)
INNER JOIN StateNamesGeo on Orders.ShipRegion = StateNamesGeo.Abbr
WHERE Orders.ShipCountry = "USA"
GROUP BY Orders.ShipRegion, Orders.ShipCountry, StateNamesGeo.StateName
ORDER BY Orders.ShipRegion
;

LayerBase.Name: kmlStates
LayerBase.Caption: kmlStates
LayerBase.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipRegion,
Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue
FROM (Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID
WHERE Orders.ShipCountry = "USA"
GROUP BY Orders.ShipRegion
ORDER BY Orders.ShipRegion;

LayerBase.Name: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.Caption: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipRegion,
Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue
FROM (Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID
WHERE Orders.ShipCountry = "USA"
GROUP BY Orders.ShipRegion
ORDER BY Orders.ShipRegion;

LayerBase.Name: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.Caption: KMLLayer0
LayerBase.RecordSource:
SELECT Orders.ShipRegion,
Sum([Order Details].UnitPrice*[Order Details].Quantity) AS OrderValue
FROM (Categories INNER JOIN Products ON Categories.CategoryID = Products.CategoryID)
INNER JOIN (Orders INNER JOIN [Order Details] ON Orders.OrderID = [Order Details].OrderID) ON Products.ProductID = [Order Details].ProductID
WHERE Orders.ShipCountry = "USA"
GROUP BY Orders.ShipRegion
ORDER BY Orders.ShipRegion;
